metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3192 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
Pivotal Spring Framework before 3.2.14 and 4.x before 4.1.7 do not properlyprocess inline DTD declarations when DTD is not entirely disabled, whichallows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumptionand out-of-memory errors) via a crafted XML file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3192` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspring-aop-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-beans-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-context-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-context-support-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-core-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-expression-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-instrument-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-jdbc-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-jms-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-messaging-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-orm-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-oxm-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-test-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-transaction-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-web-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-web-portlet-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-web-servlet-java - 4.3.14-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libspring-java package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.14-1').
